body_html:
A node with that name may not actually exist, so the error message seems a bit off.
Will the following work instead?

if (child_scope_name != nullptr) {
  const string conflict = string(prefix) + "/";
  for (const auto& pair: g->name_map) {
    const string& name = pair.first;
    if (name.compare(prefix) == 0 || str_util::StartsWith(name, conflict)) {
      status->status = InvalidArgument("prefix [", prefix, "] conflicts with existing node in the graph named [", name, "]");
      return;
   }
   ...
